bestBHT.bht: The parable of the workers in the vineyard reveals the acceptance of the eleventh hour laborers, who were not given earlier opportunities. This concept can be understood to apply to the Gentiles, who were previously neglected by God. Through the power of the Gospel, they were called into the vineyard and their response to the call led to their salvation.

Philip Schaff: Matthew 20:7. Because no man hired us. The eleventh hour laborers are accepted, but they were mainly those who had no opportunity at an earlier period.
John Gill: This may be fitly applied to the Gentiles, who hundreds of years were neglected by God.
The Gospel was made the power of God unto salvation to them.
They went into the vineyard, the call being effectual.

bhtAttempts.bht: The parable of the workers in the vineyard, depicted in Matthew 20:7, reveals that the eleventh hour laborers were accepted, primarily because they were the ones who had not been given the opportunity earlier on. This aspect of the parable can be seen as applicable to the Gentiles who had been previously neglected by God. However, through the power of the Gospel, they were called into the vineyard and their response to the call was effective in their salvation.

The parable of the workers in the vineyard highlights the acceptance of the eleventh hour laborers who had not been given the opportunity earlier. This aspect of the parable can be seen as applicable to the Gentiles who were previously neglected by God. Through the power of the Gospel, they responded effectively to the call, resulting in their salvation.

In the parable of the workers in the vineyard, the acceptance of the eleventh hour laborers who had not been given earlier opportunities is emphasized. This can be applied to the Gentiles, who were previously neglected by God but were then called into the vineyard through the power of the Gospel. Their response to the call proved to be effective, leading to their salvation.

The parable of the workers in the vineyard reveals the acceptance of the eleventh hour laborers, who were not given earlier opportunities. This concept can be understood to apply to the Gentiles, who were previously neglected by God. Through the power of the Gospel, they were called into the vineyard and their response to the call led to their salvation.

The parable of the workers in the vineyard highlights the acceptance of the eleventh hour laborers who were not given opportunities earlier. This aspect can be applied to the Gentiles, who were previously neglected by God but were called into the vineyard through the power of the Gospel. Their response to the call was effective, leading to their salvation.
